decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to use fast and efficient creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, along with pump spells like Invigorate, Berserk, and Become Immense, to quickly deal 10 points of poison damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counter spells like Daze and Force of Will, as well as cards like Stifle and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. The land base includes fetch lands to help fix mana and enable cards like Crop Rotation for additional protection or utility.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy using efficient creatures and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key aspect of the deck is to establish early board presence with cards like Delver of Secrets and Deathrite Shaman while using cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect it. The deck also utilizes card advantage through Brainstorm and Liliana of the Veil to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's diverse color requirements for its powerful spells.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By using cards like Goblin Guide and Eidolon of the Great Revel to apply early pressure, and finishers like Price of Progress and Fireblast, the aim is to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Sulfuric Vortex to provide consistent damage over time. With a mana base that supports a fast and consistent start, this deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible through direct damage.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a strong early game presence with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf. By utilizing efficient spells like Force of Will, Daze, Lightning Bolt, and Stifle, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure on the battlefield. The use of cantrips such as Ponder and Brainstorm helps to set up draws and ensure consistency in the deck's strategy. Additionally, the mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize resource denial with cards like Wasteland.

The main concept of this deck is to use disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth to slow down the opponent, while also utilizing cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Stoneforge Mystic to control the board. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with taxing effects and disruptive creatures, while also using equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to gain card advantage and close out the game quickly. Additionally, cards like Aether Vial and Wasteland help to further disrupt the opponent's strategy and provide additional utility.

This deck revolves around quickly generating a large number of Elf creatures on the battlefield through the use of cards like Glimpse of Nature, Heritage Druid, and Wirewood Symbiote. By playing multiple Elves in a turn and utilizing mana acceleration cards like Gaea's Cradle, players can easily cast powerful spells like Natural Order to search for and put a Craterhoof Behemoth into play, granting all of their creatures a massive power boost and allowing for a devastating attack to finish off the opponent in a single turn.

The deck is focused on utilizing cheap and efficient spells, along with aggressive creatures, to quickly pressure and control the opponent. By efficiently disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, alongside disruptive creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Young Pyromancer, the deck aims to quickly close out the game with damage from Lightning Bolt and tempo advantage from Delver of Secrets. The deck also includes disruption and card advantage options like Cabal Therapy and Brainstorm to maintain control of the game.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's hand and board while maintaining pressure on their life total. By using cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, you can strip away key cards from their hand, while cards like Punishing Fire and Lightning Bolt deal damage to their creatures or their life total. The deck also features efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, along with card advantage engines like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while applying a steady stream of aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary. The deck also utilizes equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull to give its creatures additional power and protection. The mana base is designed to provide access to all the necessary colors, while cards like Abrupt Decay and Liliana of the Veil help to maintain board control. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of control elements and efficient threats.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly find and play either Sneak Attack or Show and Tell, in order to put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play for a quick win. The deck includes a lot of card draw and counter spells to protect the combo, along with mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal to help quickly cast the big creatures. The deck focuses on putting huge threats into play early and overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

This deck focuses on creating a strong control game plan by utilizing powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and True-Name Nemesis. It has a variety of counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also using Stoneforge Mystic to cheat out powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with its card advantage and efficient threats, while also having access to versatile answers like Supreme Verdict and Council's Judgment. It aims to control the game and win through its powerful threats and disruption.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells while utilizing the synergy between Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to counter opponents' spells efficiently. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage to out-value opponents. It also has a win condition in the form of creatures like Monastery Mentor and Entreat the Angels. Overall, the deck focuses on disruption, card advantage, and incremental advantage to outlast opponents and secure victory.
